instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PCH_INTRUDER_L: What is PCH_INTRUDER_L? PCH_INTRUDER_L is a signal that tells the machine the case has been opened by an intruder when it is low, the _L means it is present when it is low. This signal should always be high in a Macbook since it doesnâ€™t use intrusion detection. .
definitions.PCH_SRTCRST_L: What is PCH_SRTCRST_L? PCH_SRTCRST_L is a reset signal present for the RTC circuit that asserts when it is low in voltage, that is what _L means..
definitions.PP1V05_SUS: What is PP1V05_SUS? The PP1V05_SUS signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that supplies 1.05 volts, typically used in a suspended (SUS) state of the laptop. This state is a low-power mode where essential system functions are maintained, but the majority of the system is powered down..
definitions.R7105: What is R7105? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS? This is PPBUS_G3H after passing through a current sense resistor that splits it off from the rest of PPBUS_G3H. The purpose of this is so that we can measure how much current is flowing to this part of the machine..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a orange led no power
threads.message:
hi

this motherboard was in contact with liquid
there was no green light when it first came , when it first arrived there was no green light at all. I changed the <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>,<RESISTOR>R7105</RESISTOR>,<RESISTOR>R7096</RESISTOR> and the green light came on, then I inserted the battery and the device turned on.
then i collected the device and it won't turn on. It charges but the amperage drops backwards. first current 2.15 - 2.14- 2.10 - 2.05 -1.90 counting downward current starts to decrease now there is orange light but it does not turn on

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> : 8.16 voltage
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> : 3.4 Voltage
<SIGNAL>MC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> : 3.3Voltage

<SIGNAL>PP1V05_SUS</SIGNAL>: 1.0 voltage
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> : 2.8 voltage
<SIGNAL>PCH_SRTCRST_L</SIGNAL> : 2.8 voltage
<SIGNAL>PCH_INTRUDER_L</SIGNAL> : 2.6Voltage

I don't know where to look now

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a orange led no power
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> : 8.16 voltage"
Incorrect, if was measured without battery (charger alone); it should near 8.5V.

Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and check for drop pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> (at same time).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a orange led no power
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> voltage drops to 0.41 when I press the 3.4 voltage power button. After connecting the battery and charger, the device should have turned on automatically.

8.40-45 voltage with battery installed

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a orange led no power
threads.message:
I asked voltage without battery.

If battery is already connected, board may not turn on automatically, when charger is connected...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a orange led no power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a orange led no power
threads.message:
If <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> reacts, the problem remains on PCH side.
Check if <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> reacts at same time.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a orange led no power
threads.message:
It just opened again, now it won't open again.

<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> no response no voltage

<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>: 2.8 voltage

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS</SIGNAL> :8.53 Voltage

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> : no voltage

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a orange led no power
threads.message:
<CAPACITOR>C1910</CAPACITOR> voltage?
Test the board alone on the desk; w/ and w/ LIO board connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a orange led no power
threads.message:
I heated the smc, it turned on, but the ssd is not detected. I did SMC reset, no boot sound.
<SIGNAL>ISNS_SSD_N</SIGNAL>  3.3 voltage
<SIGNAL>ISNS_SSD_L</SIGNAL> : 3.3 voltage

<SIGNAL>ISNS_P5VSSD_IOUT</SIGNAL> no voltage. <CHIP>U5480</CHIP> has been changed, still the same. Should I reball the SMC, is the problem from smc?

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_SSD_FLT</SIGNAL> : 3.3 voltage

tried different disk

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a orange led no power
threads.message:
Is the same SSD which was working before?
Not even detected in Disk Utility?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a orange led no power
threads.message:
Disk Utility disk does not appear.
I tried with 2 different disks. I also felt that the large samsung chip on the ssd was a bit too hot.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a orange led no power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a orange led no power
threads.message:
pin 1 : 3.4 voltage
pin 2 : 0.99 voltage
pin 3 : 3.2 voltage
pin 4 : 3.4 Voltage
pin 5 : GND
pin 6 : 3.2 Voltage
pin 7 : No voltage
pin 8 : No voltage

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a orange led no power
threads.message:
If board turned on after heating SMC, there must be corrosion problems.
Reball SMC and test again.
May need to heat CPU also; possibly accumulated crap underneath.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a orange led no power
threads.message: I did smc reballing, same result. There is no liquid or damaged condition in the CPU region I don't think it's CPU/pch

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a orange led no power
threads.message:
Check J3700 traces and solders.
Compare voltage on its pins with good board; 1, 7, 8, 47, 48, 49, 50.
Also try changing <CHIP>U3710</CHIP>/11.

Be sure all <CAPACITOR>C3710</CAPACITOR>-17 are good, as traces too.
